docs.snippet: In her first police interview after a YouTube video was posted accusing her of child sex abuse, a California educator acknowledged she had a sexual relationship with a young student, according to a newly released court filing....

docs.snippet: Police say Judy Lynn Hayman's luck ran out after 37 years on the run not because of an intense manhunt but rather two disparate factors: bad weather that kept an investigator at his desk and her distinctive eyes that had never changed since her mu...
docs.lead_paragraph: Police say Judy Lynn Hayman's luck ran out after 37 years on the run not because of an intense manhunt but rather two disparate factors: bad weather that kept an investigator at his desk and her distinctive eyes that had never changed since her mug shot was taken.

headline.main: Police: Disparate Factors Led to Fugitive's Arrest
headline.print_headline: Police: Disparate Factors Led to Fugitive's Arrest

docs.snippet: More than two decades after the United States pulled up its final cables from Field Station Berlin, the ruins of the complex still hold a mystical attraction for history buffs, artists and tourists....
docs.lead_paragraph: More than two decades after the United States pulled up its final cables from Field Station Berlin, the ruins of the complex still hold a mystical attraction for history buffs, artists and tourists.
docs.abstract: Berlin Journal; ruins of Field Station Berlin, once used to monitor transmissions in East German Territory during Cold War, holds mystical attraction for artists, history buffs and tourists more than two decades since it was decommissioned; site also holds significance in narratives of World War II and early paganism.

headline.main: Where N.S.A. Kept Watch in Cold War, Artists Now Find Refuge
headline.print_headline: Where N.S.A. Kept Watch in Cold War, Artists Now Find Refuge

docs.snippet: The tiny town of Warroad, Minn., which has as many indoor rinks (two) as red lights, has produced eight Olympic hockey players. The hope is for a pair of golds at the Sochi Games....
docs.lead_paragraph: The tiny town of Warroad, Minn., which has as many indoor rinks (two) as red lights, has produced eight Olympic hockey players. The hope is for a pair of golds at the Sochi Games.
docs.abstract: Tiny town of Warroad, Minn, has sent an astounding seven hockey players to the Olympic Games since 1956, all of them returning with medals, despite having population of only 1,781; locals are hoping for gold from residents Gigi Marvin and T J Oshie when they travel to the Sochi Olympics this year.
